intro: Sabatia corymbosa, commonly known as the showy milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Sabatia corymbosa plays a role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies due to its nectar-rich flowers.
